name: st_geotile
description:
Calculates the `geotile` of the supplied geo_point at the specified precision.
The result is long encoded. Use ST_GEOTILE_TO_STRING to convert the result to a string.
Or use ST_GEOTILE_TO_GEOSHAPE to convert either the long or string `geotile` to a
POLYGON geo_shape.

These functions are related to the `geo_grid` query
and the `geotile_grid` aggregation.

params.name: geometry
params.description: Expression of type `geo_point`. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

params.name: precision
params.description: Expression of type `integer`. If `null`, the function returns `null`. Valid values are between [0 and 29](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Zoom_levels).

examples:
FROM airports
| EVAL geotile = ST_GEOTILE(location, 2)
| STATS
    count = COUNT(*),
    centroid = ST_CENTROID_AGG(location)
      BY geotile
| EVAL geotileString = ST_GEOTILE_TO_STRING(geotile)
| SORT count DESC, geotileString ASC
| KEEP count, centroid, geotileString
